concept.title: Where to start
concept.shortdesc: This Users Guide is part of the larger information set that supports working with DITA.

conbody.p:
Before you begin using this guide, you should be familiar with:
Any educational materials for DITA that are available at the DITA documentation Web site.
The Getting Started with DITA guide for your editor.

You can start using the information in this Guide in a number of ways:
Print off the PDF version and read it from beginning to end, taking the tutorials when you encounter them.
Look through the concepts, which have their own section in the HTMLHelp version of the Guide.
Start directly with the tutorials, referring back to the concepts only as needed.

After you have completed the tutorials, you can use the following materials for reference:
The tasks, concepts, and samples sections of the HTMLHelp Users Guide.
The samples.zip that accompanies this guide.
The DITA Language Reference (combined with the Users Guide in online versions, available separately in PDF)
The IDWB Process and Command Guide
